english.segment1: Eye is to the body as a thought is to the soul. They're both a lamp whose sharpness I control. Beauty lingers 'bout as long as flattery my friend. That door doesn't let out but lets back in
english.segment2: I was full of everything, my eyes put on this plate. Full of joy I'm needing, less of late. I can return love to You the best that I know how. I believe my worth has been redeemed. And I can be a new man now
english.segment3: Flatterers can fill a room as readily as this. The devil goes to dinner amidst their bliss. Following the need will lead me farther from truth's well. Then only to be filled with what I miss
english.segment4: I'm a new man, I'm a new man
english.segment5: Like I said, there's always room where one keeps all things dear. I'll shrink away from sight and thought and evil that appears
english.segment6: I'm a new man, I'm a new man.
